alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Lee; Moore; Richmond (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 3:53AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett, Lee, Moore and Richmond. * WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Pines, Rockingham, Pinehurst, Aberdeen, Angier, Hoffman, Whispering Pines, Pinebluff, Broadway, Ellerbe, Foxfire, Taylortown, Vass, Cameron, Lemon Springs, Pineview and Olivia.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
